title: Presidential Nominations Sent to the Senate, 5-20-09 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




May 20, 2009

 



Presidential Nominations Sent to the Senate, 5-20-09




THE WHITE HOUSE   Office of the Press Secretary  _________________________________________________________________  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE                                    May 20, 2009  NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE:   Bartholomew Chilton, of Maryland, to be a Commissioner of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission for a term expiring April 13, 2013. (Reappointment)   Colin Scott Cole Fulton, of Maryland, to be an Assistant Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, vice Roger Romulus Martella, Jr.   Alejandro N. Mayorkas, of California, to be Director of United States Citizenship and Immigration Services, Department of Homeland Security, vice Emilio T. Gonzalez.
